Generation VI.X: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.
Generation VI.Y: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It ignites the twig from its tail and waves the twig around to signal its allies. To indicate danger, it draws circles in the air with the twig’s flame.
Generation IX.Violet: Braixen’s branch ignites as it’s pulled from the Pokémon’s tail. Braixen then uses the flame to spark powerful attacks.
